guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

ROFL. There are about a million websites on the internet that will prove that it's not a biological impossibility. People do it every single day. Dogs do it. Dolphins do it. Ducks do it. Even hedgehogs do it. Homosexual sex is one of the most natural things in the world, the list of animals that don't have gay sex can be counted on the fingers of one hand.

That's like saying it's impossible to mix milk products and meat products in the same food, another thing which the Bible bans. Or to eat shrimp, which the Bible also bans. Or to have a tattoo, which the Bible also bans. Or to mix two different fibres in the one cloth, also banned.

Imagine thinking that something as natural as that is wicked, all because some savages wandering around in the desert cutting off the foreskin of their boy children had some sexual hangups.

Tattoos: **banned**. Eating shrimp: **banned**. Cotton/nylon mixed clothes: **banned**. Cheese burgers: **banned**. Women talking in church: **banned**. Men with deformities being a preacher: **banned**.

But talking of Sodom, do you know what's not banned by the Bible?

Lot tells a group of strangers to gang rape his daughters, that's not banned, God approves of gang-rape so much that Lot is declared the only moral and godly person in Sodom and Gomorrah. So this worthless piece of shit, who offered his daughters up to be gang-raped, gets saved, but his wife who did nothing more than glance back over her shoulder gets turned into a pillar of salt. And when the city gets destroyed, hundreds of innocent unborn babies and children get killed.

And this is the vile poisonous shit you think is morality?

I know what sexual intercourse is, and I don't need to look it up in the dictionary to find out. But if you insist:

*Intercourse* means an exchange, especially of thoughts or feelings; connection or dealings between people, as in *social intercourse*. [Sexual intercourse](https://medical-dictionary.thefreedictionary.com/sexual+intercourse) is any such exchange, connection or dealings involving physical contact between two (or more) individuals involving stimulation of the genital organs of at least one.

*Sexual intercourse* includes "titty fucking", frottage, scissoring, fingering, mutual masturbation, coitus (penile-vaginal insertion), oral sex and anal sex, and other activities that don't necessarily have a name.

Imagine what a shitty lover you would be if you think that sexual intercourse is limited to merely the piston mechanics of "wham, bam, thank you ma'am". Pathetic and sad.

body:
> It is true. Genesis 19:6 and the mob were outside the house and couldn't get in, that's why they were shouting for Lot to let them in.

They were giving him a chance to do it "the easy way". Otherwise they'd have done it "the hard way".

> Yeah, so? Two strangers are more important than your own children? Lot called them "Lords", so he probably knew they were angels and they could look after themselves. But even if he didn't, well, there is only so far you can go to protect others. Your own children come first.

It's a story. Perhaps one of the people who adapted it lived in a time when it was not viewed as wrong for fathers to treat their children and grandchildren like property, especially daughters. Perhaps even Lot himself. Very wrong but easy for our groupthink-minded nature to overlook when everyone else does it too.

Also treating people differently because of their biological relation to you is condemned multiple times by Jesus. As we are all one family.

> Right. And the lesson here is that the raping women is fine, killing the unborn, babies, children, and women is fine, and that the Bible's morality is poison.

The earliest references to Sodom and Gomorrah (before Genesis was written) all agree that its primary evil was inhospitality. They were selfish, violent, and greedy. The lesson is that this is deserving of death, but God is faithful and will save you if you only listen. It's much the same as Noah.

> Not true, they were in a desperate situation and the mob would've killed them

It is true. Genesis 19:6 and the mob were outside the house and couldn't get in, that's why they were shouting for Lot to let them in.

> In fact the evil thing that the mob was trying to do was rape the angels visiting Lot.

Yeah, so? Two strangers are more important than your own children? Lot called them "Lords", so he probably knew they were angels and they could look after themselves. But even if he didn't, well, there is only so far you can go to protect others. Your own children come first.

Besides, the whole story is just so childish. *Every* man in the city, young and old, came to Lot's house to rape the angels. Not just "a mob", but every single man in the whole city.

> Remember most of these stories are probably made up or adapted to teach a lesson

Right. And the lesson here is that the raping women is fine, killing the unborn, babies, children, and women is fine, and that the Bible's morality is poison.
